description.narrative: Insatsen avser att stödja den guatemalanska statistikmyndigheten INE genom att dels bidra till INEs genomförande av den landsomfattande undersökningen av fattigdom och livsvillkor i Guatemala, ENCOVI. I beslut av den 26 november 2014, (beslutsnummer GUA UTV/2014/47) har Sida genom Sveriges ambassad, Guatemala, givit finansiellt stöd till ENCOVI med ett belopp om två miljoner kronor men via organisationen ASIES. ASIES har för INEs räkning gjort upphandlingar av bränsle och hyrt fordon för INEs fältarbete. I denna insats ingick också ett avrop om ett belopp 2, 5 miljoner kronor via Sidas ramavtal med Statistiska centralbyrån för att få en diagnos för möjligheterna till ett mer ingående och i tiden långvarigt samarbete mellan SCB och INE för att stärka INE institutionellt och tekniskt.

The contribution aims to support the Guatemalan statistical office INE by contributing to INE´s implementation of the country-wide survey of poverty and living conditions in Guatemala (ENCOVI) through an agreement between Sweden and Guatemala to ensure that INE may perform the life survey during the first months of 2015.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The Guatemalan National Institute of Statistics (INE) managed to successfully carry out the country-wide survey of poverty and living conditions in Guatemala (ENCOVI) as planned and the results of the survey were presented officially in December 2015. The survey is intended to serve as an important instrument in political planning and decision-making in Guatemala. However, the Swedish funds were not used in its totality due to certain delays in the project implementation and when the total funds finally where disbursed in June 2016 INE was unable to use the greater part of the amount because of state regulations regarding the national budget that does not allow an institution to use finances not planned for in the annual budget. INE used some of the Swedish funding for dissemination activities of the survey and presentations in regional events in various parts of the country, which involved costs for publications of the survey and information material.
This contribution also included the elaboration of a diagnostic carried out by the Swedish Statistics Bureau (SCB) with the aim of assessing possibilities for cooperation between INE and SCB in the area of institutional strengthening and capacity building in statistics of INE. A fact-finding mission from SCB visited Guatemala in November 2014 and a report was submitted to the Embassy in July 2015. The report described several areas, such as economic statistics, environmental statistics, IT, management etc, that were proposed to be included in a cooperation project between the two institutions. A final project proposal for institutional strengthening was submitted by SCB to the Embassy in January 2016 and the proposal was approved by the Embassy.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
